Class UI

java.lang.Object
io.mygame.ui.UI
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogueUI, IntroGameUI, MainGameUI, MainMenuUI
public abstract class UI extends Object
The UI class is an abstract class that serves as the base for all user interfaces in the game. It handles the common functionality of setting up and rendering the UI elements, including managing the input processor and handling the skin used for UI elements.

  • Constructor Details

    • UI

      public UI(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.viewport.Viewport viewport, ScreenState screenState, com.badlogic.gdx.Game game)
      Constructs the UI object with the provided viewport, screen state, and game instance. Initializes the stage, skin, and game manager, and sets the input processor for the stage.
      Parameters:
      viewport - The viewport for the stage.
      screenState - The screen state for tracking the current screen.
      game - The game instance.

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render()
      Renders the stage by updating and drawing the UI elements.

    • resize

      public void resize(int width, int height)
      Resizes the stage viewport when the window size changes.
      Parameters:
      width - The new width of the window.
      height - The new height of the window.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of the resources used by the UI, including the skin and stage.

    • getGame

      public com.badlogic.gdx.Game getGame()
      Gets the game instance associated with the UI.
      Returns:
      The game instance.
